content: Hi, does anyone know how to get the exact VSCode config used in the Changelog gifs? It would be cool to have something similar to Portacle for Common-Lisp where you could download a optimally pre-configure editor.
the gifs are made by different people with different configs
Ah yes I hadn't noticed that before. Coming from NeoVim/Emacs I find VSCode awful to configure with its huge JSON file.

As far as rust-analyzer specific settings, I think the defaults are "optimally pre-configured". Like, if there's a setting that we think should be enabled by every user, it'll be enabled by default ;) So getting a good VSCode experience should mostly just consist of installing the plugin. I don't use VSCode though, so maybe I'm missing something
there may be some additional plugins for debugging or for showing errors inline

Thanks for the insight. I think you're right and the default rust-analyzer settings do seem fine. I guess it's just all the little extra bits and pieces I'm missing. I'm currently using Doom Emacs which has really good defaults in terms of the lsp-ui etc. It's just that lsp-mode seems to get into incorrect states quite frequently and the workspace needs restarting. I feel like I need to make the move to VSCode where most of the work is being done but I really dislike the GUI/Configuration method.
hmm, I use Emacs and don't experience those problems
I'm not sure what you mean by "where most of the work is being done". lsp-mode is being actively developed
Would you mind sharing your config? Apologies I meant no disrespect to the lsp-mode devs, I just meant that VSCode in general has more developers, paid and voluntary behind it than any other editor
my configuration is here (I use spacemacs, though I've considered switching to Doom). I don't think whatever bug you're experiencing is related to the config though
my config is also full of cruft, so probably not a good example
On the topic of Doom Emacs, there is this issue https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/issues/6201 that I was able to reproduce
I'm not sure why it would work less well there than in a vanilla one
I'm not sure I understand what the actual problem in that issue is
I do get the "is still loading" errors, but only while RA is still loading
Yeah, I don't actually remember why I thought it acted weirdly. I see those errors once in a while in Code, but I think emacs got a lot more
spacemacs is working fine with the rust config layer not rust-rls2
coc in nvim also works really well
oh nm rust-rls2 is working and looks more feature-full
rust-rls2 is my own customized layer from back when RA wasn't officially supported yet; probably nowadays the rust layer will work fine
interesting thanks!
I should redo my whole config and switch to Doom at some point
I hear only good things
